name: Kepler-347
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-347 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-347 is a star with 0.9470000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1 times its radius. It is located 4401.31 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-347 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-347 b

Kepler-347 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.80 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-347.

The mass of Kepler-347 b is 4.91 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-347 b is 1.97 that of Earth. At 4.91 Earth masses, Kepler-347 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-347 c

Kepler-347 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 27.32 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-347.

The mass of Kepler-347 c is 3.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-347 c is 1.75 that of Earth. At 3.68 Earth masses, Kepler-347 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-347, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
